          The Dish: Candle Cafe’s Cajun Seitan Sandwich

          By Ben Barna August 26, 2010

          What: Bánh Mì Maison, a three terrine sandwich, with daikon and cilantro.

          Where: Má Pêche. David Chang’s Momofuku Midtown outpost in the Chambers Hotel is French-Vietnamese at its best. literally melting on your tongue, coupled with a crisp-around-the-edges, moist-in-the middle.

          Bottom line: $10. Not exorbitant, and it’s a filling will spend the same amount on a soggy deli roll sandwich or a meal deal Pate and pork roll melting on your tongue, at chain restaurants.
